hypothesis_content.title: BTC Volatility Squeeze Breakout with Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a volatility squeeze (Bollinger Band width < 0.1) in NEUTRAL regime, a breakout above the 20-period upper Bollinger Band with volume > 1.5x 20-day average will lead to continued momentum in the breakout direction for 3-5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression in neutral markets often precedes significant directional moves. The combination of tight Bollinger Bands and high volume breakout provides a high-probability signal that institutional money is entering the market, overcoming previous resistance levels.
entry_conditions: BTC Bollinger Band width (20,2) < 0.1 for 5 consecutive periods
BTC price closes above upper Bollinger Band (20,2)
Volume on breakout candle > 1.5x 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5% gain from entry or price touches upper Keltner Channel (20,1.5)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Close below middle Bollinger Band (20-period SMA)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such breakouts fail to sustain momentum (close back inside Bollinger Bands within 2 days) or result in immediate mean reversion.
